## Summary

I have successfully completed **Step 3: Research & Clarification** for issue #11 and posted comprehensive findings to the GitHub issue.

### Key Research Accomplishments:

**1. Technical Background Research:**
- Identified best practices for full-text search in Python/tkinter applications
- Found standard patterns for confirmation dialogs using `messagebox.askyesno()`
- Researched file export standards (JSON and plain text formats)
- Investigated datetime filtering approaches for conversation history

**2. Best Practices Identified:**
- Real-time search using StringVar with trace for automatic UI updates
- Left sidebar filter placement (consistent with current design)
- Standard confirmation dialog patterns for destructive actions
- Industry-standard export formats used by ChatGPT and Slack

**3. Refined Specifications:**
- Search: Case-insensitive across title AND message content with real-time filtering
- Date filtering: Start/end date fields with validation
- Deletion: Confirmation dialog with active session handling
- Export: Both JSON (programmatic) and plain text (human-readable) formats
- File selection: Using tkinter's native file dialogs

**4. Alternative Approaches Evaluated:**
- Decided against external libraries (Whoosh, SQLite) to maintain simplicity
- Chose visible buttons over right-click menus for better discoverability
- Rejected Markdown export to focus on specified requirements

**5. Implementation Phases Recommended:**
- Phase 1: Search/Filter functionality
- Phase 2: Session deletion with confirmation
- Phase 3: Export capabilities

### Sources Referenced:
- [Python tkinter documentation](https://docs.python.org/3/library/dialog.html)
- [Search UX best practices](https://www.designmonks.co/blog/search-ux-best-practices)
- [PatternFly Chatbot patterns](https://www.patternfly.org/patternfly-ai/chatbot/chatbot-conversation-history/)
- [Whoosh full-text search](https://github.com/mchaput/whoosh)
- [vCon conversation data standard](https://www.ietf.org/archive/id/draft-ietf-vcon-vcon-core-01.html)
- [Slack export guide](https://slack.com/help/articles/201658943-Export-your-workspace-data)
- And several other authoritative sources

The research provides a solid foundation for implementation with clear, actionable specifications while maintaining consistency with the existing codebase architecture (pure tkinter, JSON storage, simple patterns).
